intro: Gymnogramma auriculatum, commonly known as the ear-shaped spleenwort, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves that often have a distinctive auriculate (ear-like) base. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, including sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. Gymnogramma auriculatum is widely distributed in tropical and subtropical regions around the world.
